intro: Alsodeia monticola, commonly known as the mountain alsike, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, and its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Alsodeia monticola is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to improve soil fertility through nitrogen fixation.
